reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the atmosphere in MacNeans lovely. There was a nice rapport in the waiting area, and staff were very attentive. The food is very much fine dining. With every course, you will get several versions of what you have ordered. I had the soup for starter, which was nice. It had a dumpling in the middle. Then I had a duck dish consisting of duck cooked four ways. The foie gras was amazing. Then I had the dry aged beef. It was alright. Just like a nice roast beef with gravy. My wife had the pork, and it was in a different league altogether. Desserts and petit fours were lovely. The star of the show here is definitely Neven Maguire. He was so nice to talk to and genuinely friendly, and grateful to see us. The bill was pricey, but you are paying for the quality and the name. A minor gripe was that we were booked for the 9pm sitting, but ended up starting our meal at 10pm, and finishing around midnight. It's very late to be finishing a heavy meal really. On the whole I won't be back, unless I get treated to a special occasion again ! Hats off to Neven for the way he runs his business and his really friendly manner
reviews.title: Very nice but eating far too late

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: Exceptional experience all round.
reviews.title: Wow, Neven Maguire and Macnean House should be made a national treasure, Brillant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Starting with the most warmest of welcomes from the charming staff which were delightful throughout our stay.
reviews.title: Good but not amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Outstanding food, Mac Neans outshines anywhere else we have been, including Dublin's finest. Simply, there is nothing like the quality of the food and service here
reviews.title: Macnean House never disappoints!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Accomadation beautiful and immaculate.
reviews.title: well done Macnean House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The best restaurant that i have ever ate in .. i have eaten in many in London and nothing comes close to mac nean house. It should have a Michelin star if not 3..
reviews.title: Classy .. A little Gem in the countryside! Innocence is Bliss!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The food is amazing and well worth the waiting list!
reviews.title: Sad to see that MacNeans, while good, has lost its edge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You just can get everything at mac nean house best thing in Ireland since sliced bread seriously! I had a pumpkin soup to start was slickly and full of flavour with the best bread and butter in the world.
reviews.title: utterly fab

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had the rack of lamb for main course however I thought that the herb crust was very strong and overpowered the lamb however the lamb was of extreme quality and cooked to my liking rare/medium. The desserts were very good I had the chocolate plate which highlight French classics such as an opera cake was very nice and the chocolate tasted very good!
reviews.title: Amazing experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The petite fours at the end were such delightful which included a French macaroon also other pastry’s and cakes which were very good! The service was very good and down to earth and treats everyone which care and respect the attention to detail that mac nean good to is remarkable!
reviews.title: Just Wonderful !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best culinary experience my husband and I have had. We had waited a long time to book in to this restaurant. Imelda ,the receptionist extended a most warm welcome to us and after tea and home baked biscuits she showed us to our room in the original family home. The room was beautifully decorated. We choose the dinner menu as opposed to Prestige menu. Every course was a culinary delight. Taste and presentation was outstanding. . What we liked in particular were those little surprises that came to us between courses. An atmosphere of congeniality in the dining grew to the point that we had a wonderful with the couple seated next to us. The food was exquisite and the atmosphere was homely.We really liked the explanation that the table attendant gave to point out the culinary delights of each dish. We were given an indication by Imelda that the breakfast was going to be special and at certainly turned out to be so. Presentation and taste was first class . We will certainly be back.
reviews.title: A night to remember

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Myself, two sisters and my mother went here for my mothers birthday. We stayed out in the courtyard house, which was a beautiful two bedroom house. With loving living area etc. We checked in at the hotel and were then driven to the house. We told them a time to collect us at and they collected us and brought us to the restaurant. Imelda Nevan's wife greeted everyone and was lovely. We had the taster menu with wine selection, The food was divine, the wine was great and the service was great. Glass of champagne to start and then various white and red wines. The staff explained each food and wine course. Everything was perfect. We will definitely return and tried to book it again for this year in June but it is fully booked for accomodation. When we return the four of us agreed that we will not go for the wine selection as it was quite a bit of wine, we would just order our wine separately. After our meal we were brought back to the lounge area. Nevan himself was walking around and I stopped him and explained it was my mothers birthday and he came over and met her and we all had our photos taken and he give her a DVD. So he was really nice. We also had the option of getting our breakfast served in the house or having a bigger range of breakfast in the restaurant, He recommended that we get the breakfast in the restaurant as its a good experience. He was right. The breakfast was fantastic. A real treat. Overall for 4 meals including the wine courses and the accomodation we paid around €700. So it was costly enough for one night, but a lovely treat and well worth it. Would definitely recommend it and will return.
reviews.title: Excellent food, excellent accomodation, will definitely return. A lovely treat for someone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say about MacNean House that hasn't been said already? Probably nothing because it's all been said and is all so positive and is all true. We visited last year and promised ourselves a return visit. We rang the day the book opened and booked another 2 night stay.
reviews.title: Return Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I was a little worried it would not live up to how good it was the 1st time. Well no need to worry. Not only did it live up to it, it surpassed it. The amazing food was somehow improved on. The staff as always were 1st class without it seeming false and they took a genuine interest in what you were doing during your stay and delighted to have us there for 2 nights.
reviews.title: Surpassed all expectations!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: We stayed in the standard room and it was lovely, huge storage space, fantastic shower and as always the lovely homemade cookies in the room!
reviews.title: Wow wow and wow some more!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was here with my partner on the 8th of June. It was one of the best experiances of our lives. To say the food was delicious would not do it justice. It was out of this world! the staff were pleasent and helpful and Neven himself came to talk to every group in the bar before and after the meal. the rooms were clean and spacious and the nice personal touches didn't go unnoticed. we had the pleasure of staying ther on a night that a guest had brough along a guitar and played wnderful music until the small hours in the morning, much to the delight of a huge number of guests staying there that night (although I think ther was a complaint from some old granny in bed saying we were all too loud). That didnt stop the fun and the whole afternoon and night was a huge success.
reviews.title: Just go there, then you'll understand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got up for breakfast the next morning to the most splendid breakfast i believe i have ever tasted. Again the staff couldn't have been nicer.
reviews.title: A wonderful treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Well done MacNean House, well done!
reviews.title: best food ever tasted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Blacklion is not in a central location. There is not much to see in the locality, although the original Ballroom of Romance in one direction and Marble Arch Caves in another are indeed points of interest. But if MacNeans was in the middle of the desert it would still be worth making the trip. If you enjoy food, go there at least once.
reviews.title: Once again MacNean House has excelled itself!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Neven himself greeted all diners before dinner started and spent some time with each group. This is not a 'name above the door' place. This personal touch is everywhere, with all staff friendly and helpful, gratuities shared between all staff, details of allergies already taken into account when dealing with menus, a great feeling of joy coming from the team about the business of nourishing and relaxing visitors.
reviews.title: Memorable Night
